descript.abstract: Category 1 Hurricane risks developed from SLOSH ensemble runs (64) for the Wilmington - Myrtle Beach basin. The SLOSH data, both averages and standard deviation values, were calculated for each SLOSH cell and used with an 18 m DEM to create Z-scores for each pixel. The Z-scores were then converted to percent values. The percent values indicate the % chance of a pixel to be flooded from storm surge (waves not modeled) during a land-falling category 1 hurricane. This analysis does not include any DEM error analysis since the SLOSH data themselves have a high degree of uncertainty.
descript.purpose: Category 1 hurricane projected risks were developed to highlight hurricane storm conditions that are consistent with a typical land-falling hurricane in the area. These risks are not defined as yearly values, but what may be considered in terms of a probable risk occurrence over decadal (10 year) time frames.

idinfo.useconst: Not intended for insurance or FEMA rate maps.
idinfo.datacred: Sea Lake Overland Surge Heights (SLOSH) data - NOAA; Digital Elevation Model - Horry County; Analysis - Keil Schmid, Geoscience Consultants.

metainfo.metstdn: FGDC Content Standard for Digital Geospatial Metadata
